definitions.definition: Type of singing done generally without instruments and harmony .
A short and simple melody to which unmetrical psalms , etc., are sung or recited.

subdefinitions.definition: A harmonized melody used in Anglican chant , usually split into two two-bar phrases, to which the words of a psalm are sung by a choir ; typically, each musical phrase corresponds to the text of half of a verse .

definitions.definition: Twang ; manner of speaking; a canting tone .
A repetitive song, typically an incantation or part of a ritual .

main_definition: Type of singing done generally without instruments and harmony .
secondary_definitions: ( music ) A short and simple melody to which unmetrical psalms , etc., are sung or recited.
Twang ; manner of speaking; a canting tone .
A repetitive song, typically an incantation or part of a ritual .
